addresseeName.description: Description of the name of a physical person
addresseeName.title: Name

title.description: Contains all the suffixes and prefixes that can be appended to a name - Mr, Miss, Pr. - E.g. " Mr".

maidenName.description: The name given at birth time and that may have changed after a marriage.

middleName.description: Middle name(s), for example "Lee" in "John Lee Smith".

referenceName.description: Indicator to advise if the name is a reference name

transliterationMethod.description: The method (if applicated) that was used to transform the name from universal character (e.g. korean characters) to latin characters/phonetic transcription/...

nameType.description: the type of the reference name - When several name entities exist for a given Name element(e.g. Universal name, both Native names, Romanized name), the notion of reference name (i.e. active or main name) exists. It can be either the Universal name or the Native name/Phonetic name.

displayName.description: Signifies if the name is displayed on PNR face

fullName.description: free flow ,  Concatenation of first/mid/last. No order, no restriction, no pattern, blank separator ....

addresseeName.description: Adressee name (e.g. in case of emergency purpose it corresponds to name of the person to be contacted).

deviceType.description: Type of the device (Landline, Mobile or Fax)

countryCode.description: Country code of the country (ISO3166-1). E.g. "US" for the United States

countryCallingCode.description: Country calling code of the phone number, as defined by the International Communication Union. Examples - "1" for US, "371" for Latvia.

areaCode.description: Corresponds to a regional code or a city code. The length of the field varies depending on the area.

number.description: Phone number. Composed of digits only. The number of digits depends on the country.

text.description: String containing the full phone number - applicable only when a structured phone (i.e. countryCallingCode + number) is not provided

lines.description: Line 1 = Street address, Line 2 = Apartment, suite, unit, building, floor, etc

stateCode.description: State code (two character standard IATA state code)

text.description: Field containing a full unformatted address. Only applicable when the fields lines, postalCode, countryCode, cityName are not filled.

notificationType.description: the preferred method of notifying this Contact of events

language.description: the preferred language of communication with this Contact

purpose.description: the purpose for which this contact is to be used

isDeclined.description: Justification why the "contact" structure is empty - the subject was asked, if they wish to provide contact details, but they decided to decline to provide it for the purpose listed above

comment.description: a general comment about this Contact

source.description: The source system which added the Contact information

priority.description: The priority for this Contact information

isThirdParty.description: If set, this flag indicates that the contact belongs to an other person than the passenger (e.g. friend or family member not part of the trip). This option is only available for mobile phone and email and for a notification purpose.
